alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 4:17PM EDT until May 08 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Pennsylvania...including the following county...Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 416 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Flooding is occurring on the Perkiomen Creek at East Greenville. Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - For Perkiomen Creek at East Greenville: At 3:47pm the stage was 5.69 feet. Flood Stage is 5 feet. ... For West Branch Perkiomen Creek at Hillegass: At 3:15pm the stage was 2.5 feet. Flood Stage is 5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
